description:
The purpose of this seminar is to introduce the roles of
statistics in science, and how to spot and avoid various
fallacies that are common in how laymen understand
uncertainty and the scientific method. It will expose
misunderstandings of science, deliberate misinformation
about scientific results, and even fraud in science, and
seek to explain why these arose. The seminar will touch
upon almost all aspects of life worth thinking about: food,
medicine, experimentation, homeopathy, climate change,
terrorism, cigarettes, eggs with two yolks in them, police
mergers, ethnic profiling, psychic powers, drugs, human
cloning, wars, and the little red light that indicates your
television is on standby mode.
title: Junk science, good science, and statistics
